content.description: Bolted seam that is somewhat fractured but solid
content.location: Route is in the next alcove about 100 ft right of The dollop.  Three routes are currently in alcove.  Route is the right of two routes on a wall that faces north.  This route is the right of the two, the left route is a bolted 5.10c.  These routes are on the border between Sandy Cove and the Aretes.

content.description: Scary looking chimney. I wounder what the pro would be like. I bet there are cracks on the inside walls.
content.protection: please tell me if you know.
content.location: You cant miss it. Walk south along the wall and look up. I doubt it ever sees sunlight.

content.description: THis is the obvious crack in the middle of the left most wall with routes on it at Rainbow. Climb the crack to a bolted anchor.
Boulder problem of the deck to clip first bolt.

Spectacular face climb on good quality rock. Get your mental game on, as most of this climb is very friction-dependent. The bolts are spaced quite far apart, with some insecure moves in some places. Make sure you are confident at the grade. That being said, this is a great sport climb, and one that should not be missed. Above the first bolt, the climbing is PG13. Getting to the first bolt is a bit headier, as it is very high off the ground. A stick clip may not even reach!
content.protection: Climb past 5 bolts to a set of anchors.
content.location: Located on the beautiful north-facing wall in Sandy Cove Area #2. Obvious bolt line straight up the middle/right side of the face.

content.description: Climb up a flake, clipping a bolt, and heading for a hand crack that leads to more bolts with occasional gear placements to supplement bolts as needed. Fun route.
content.protection: Mixed. You can supplement the bolts with  #.5 to #2 BD camalots. Bolted anchors.
content.location: To the right of Druce Crack.

content.description: On the face between Disneyesque and the left facing large corner are a couple of cracks and very shallow corners/flakes that lead up and slightly to the right to join the big corner. The rock is loose but the climbing relatively safe. I did not find the anchor to this one and it appears that you could break left to reach the anchors of Disneyesque towards the top. I did not, until I had passed the anchors about 6-7 feet to my left and climbed harder territory, past an overhang and some blocks. Beware.
content.protection: Good selection of gear up to #3, maybe a #4 BD. See above for word on anchors.
content.location: Just to the left of the large corner, and to the right of disneyesque.

content.description: To the left of the obvious crack of Disneyesque, is another crack and shallow corner that leads up to more cracks and shallow corners. Great variety of movement on this fun route.
content.protection: Standard rack up to #3. Good opportunities for gear lead up to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Between Owl be All Right and Disneyesque. Just to the left of Disnetesque, not the wider crack.

content.description: Straightforward face climbing past horizontal cracks.
content.protection: Reasonable variety of gear including nuts. Bolts for anchors.
content.location: Left most route in what is called Sandy Cove Area #1 in Michelle's book.

content.description: Boulder moves past every bolt.
content.location: Far left side of Sandy Cove Wall.  Shares start with Cabbage Patch which goes right,

content.description: Start at a thin crack up to a horizontal to clip the first bolt. Continue up sustained and difficult thin edge climbing past more bolts to the anchors.
content.location: Between Disco Inferno and Druce Crack.

content.description: Climb the face clippin bolts to the anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of Getting Hard on the left most wall at Rainbow (1. Sandy Cove Area).

content.description: Climb the face and crack up over a small bulge then head up to the bolted anchor.
content.location: To the right of Union Atlantic on the far left of the canyon.

content.description: Climb the splitter up the center of the face, passing a wide section and a small roof.
content.protection: Doubles from .75-3", with a single #4 and #5.
content.location:
Located at the far left end of the main wall. 

  Single rap from bolts.

content.description: Climb dihedral to pedestal, following bolts moving up and  left to off width, hand crack and face above.
content.protection: 6 QDs for bolts,   1 (optional): 1",   1:  2",  1: 2.5" cams for upper crack, 3-4 of pieces for the starting dihedral-look!
content.location: 15 ft right of stink bug to dihedral around the corner

content.description: Thin to hands crack leads up to off-width climbing. About half way up, the crack turns 90 degrees to the right for 5-6 feet and eventually turns sharply upward again never leaving off-width size. Fun and interesting moves.
content.protection: Standard rack with larger sizes for the off-width sections. You could bring doubles of 5-8" and place them all. Bolted anchors.
content.location: Obvious crack in the middle of Sandy Cove Area #1 in Michelle's book.

content.description: Start on top of a detached flake and climb up the south facing wall and arete on right. Fun route pulling on edges and pockets with an occasional pull on the arete.
content.protection: Clipping bolts the whole way. 7, I believe. Bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: To the left of and around the corner from Druce Crack.

content.description: Clip first bolt of" getting warm" and move right following bolt line.  Optional 1" piece at diagonal crack traverse of ledge up high
content.protection: Quick draws, optional 1" piece for diagonal crack
content.location: Right most route on first sandy cove wall, first bolt of getting warm

climbs.name: Confederate Pacific
climbs.fa: Gary Fike and Tonia Fike, mid 1990's

content.description: Follow bolts through a cruxy roof and then, if you brought gear, continue past the midway anchor using a thin crack and ramp to get established in the fingers and wider just above. Easy to the anchors after that.
content.protection: Bulls to the midway anchor and then thin to 1" to the top anchor.

content.description: Sandy Cove Area. The leftmost wall in Rainbow Canyon.
